column1: #text=The first step to planting a tree is to find a suitable spot for the tree .
#text=One thing many people do not think about is the amount of airspace needed once the tree actually starts growing .
#text=make sure there are know power-lines or other objects that may be affected the growing tree .
#text=After a suitable spot is found , get a shovel and dig a whole large enough to cover the entire base off the tree with at least six inches of soil to spare on top of the trees root bulb .
#text=When the hole is dug , shake some of the loose dirt from the tree 's root bulb and then place the tree into the newly created hole .
#text=Pack the area around the hole and tree bulb with some of the dirt that was excavated from the hole .
#text=Water the hole , the use the shovel to pat the area around the tree down .
